summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Ad Hoc Committee on Legislative Affairs of the City of Dallas will convene on May 7, 2024, at 9:00 AM in the Council Chambers, 6th Floor, City Hall. The meeting aims to discuss legislative priorities and processes for the upcoming year.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the previous meeting held on December 11, 2023.
2. Consideration of the 2025 Federal Legislative Priorities, including an overview of the process for establishing these priorities.

**Important Details**:  
The meeting will feature a briefing led by the Office of Government Affairs, detailing the proposed federal legislative priorities for 2025. This discussion will outline the strategic approach the committee intends to take in advocating for the city's interests at the federal level.

**Action Items**:  
The committee will seek approval for the minutes from the last meeting and will discuss and potentially endorse the 2025 Federal Legislative Priorities. The outcomes of these discussions will inform the city's legislative agenda moving forward.

The meeting will be accessible to the public both in-person and via videoconference, ensuring transparency and community engagement.
